result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary M Burk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COMPLETE RESTITUTION TO BE DETERMINED AT FUTURE HEARING.

AS OF 12/15/2016: Restitution as ordered:
$850.00 BAIL APPLIED.
$4,849.05 to Monona Bank, Monona, WI
$3,253.65 to Anchor Bank of Madison, WI
$1,764.80 to First Community Bank of Milton, WI
$3,435.24 to Sunset Bank of Waukesha, WI
Court sets restitution at ZERO to Robert Ford since he did not appear at hearing.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

File tax returns each year and provide copy to Agent - any tax refund to be applied towards restitution.  Follow through with any other terms, conditions and/or treatment recommended by Agent.  Maintain employment as level capable to be determined by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

$3,253.65 to Anchor Bank of Madison, WI

$1,764.80 to First Community Bank of Milton, WI

$3,435.24 to Sunset Bank of Waukesha, WI

Court sets restitution at $0 to Robert Ford since victim did not appear for the hearing.  

Amount to be repaid per month to be determined by agent.

To Dept of Corrections for transfer fee.

Letter dated 10/24/16 filed with attachments by Atty Benedict requesting the court release $150.00 of the bail money still being held in order to pay the fee that is required for transferring his probation to Illinois.

Approved.  Release the bail to the poster, so that he can cover this fee.  Restitution will have to get paid through probation
Restitution hearing on December 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Gary M Burk in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Counts 2, 5, 6 and 9 of the amended information.  Counts 1, 3, 4, 7, 8 and 10 are dismissed and read-in.  Defense requests date for restitution hearing.  The Defendant was given the following:

COUNT 2:

WITHHELD SENTENCE:

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S) CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER AND ANY OTHER SENTENCES
Probation may be transfered through the Inter State Compact to Cook County, Illinois

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any other terms, conditions and/or treatment recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment as level capable to be determined by Agent;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*File tax returns each year and provide copy to Agent; any tax refund to be applied towards restitution.

RESTITUTION:  to be determined 
State requests the following restitution amounts:
  $4,350.84 to Robert Ford (Waukesha County case)
  $3,435.25 to Sunset Bank (Waukesha County case)
  $4,849.05 and $3,253.65 to unknown (Dane County cases)
  $1,764.80 to unknown (Rock Count case)

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DRGOD:  $10.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation).
